content:
You are a screenplay dramaturg, who focusses mainly on art-house film and films that are not in the mainstream, you are giving feedback on a short film which talks about consciousness, anesthesia and pure oblivion. Analyse these next scenes for the opening of my short film: 

EXT. FIELD IN BETWEEN THE HILLS - DAY
It’s still early in the morning, a cloudy, grey sky over a
field in between Romanian hills. A sound of music is
stretched indefinitely. The note that seems to intend to
linger, singled out for eternity. Waves of strings-chords go
in and out. A vague melody is discernable. (Die Zwei Blaue
Augen - a song by Gustav Mahler)

BLACK SCREEN

Silence.

HER: (V.O.)
Imagine... a cloud.
What does it look like?

Screen stays black.

INT. LIVING ROOM CABIN - DAY
A landscape of skin on skin. MAN and WOMAN. The woman, her
eyes closed, is resting on his bare chest. Her head moves
with his breathing. His hand and fingertips are caressing her
arms. Her cheeks. A finger plays with her thin dark hair.
Meanwhile, a sound is slowly growing in volume: We start to
hear wind blowing, rustling through trees, calls of a distant
bird. The sound of the countryside.
She has her eyes still closed, her head still gently moving
with his breathing. The camera slowly moves in on her naked
skin.

HER: (V.O.)
A cloud is in the air.
Made of water.
Thousands, millions of small
particles.
All loose but still connected.
Floating, somehow.
Once you’re in it,
In a cloud,
you’ll see it’s all just haze.
